website_summaries.verdict: A handsome 3D printer with lots of intuitive "help" built in for the beginner. This is a smart entry-level purchase.
pros: Calibration/leveling is fairly easy with built-in checks and balances to make sure you're doing it right
Some filament is included, but you'll likely want to buy your own
cons: A few durability concerns have been reported by owners at the one-year mark

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level 3D Printer. I would suggest anyone looking to get into 3D printing to get this. You quickly learn the ins and outs of 3D printing, and can make things with reasonable detail. I had a purpose for getting mine. I built a 3D Board for my Hero Quest Board Game System.
customer_reviews.author: william g mcdowell

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a year. Customer service was worthless. Will not recognize warranty if bought from Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my home business. Love the first few prints, came out great! Then after a few months it stop printing things out great, the prints were failing. I contacted Flashforge and they were unhelpful. Complication was poor, they would not recognize warranty because they said Amazon is not part of there authored seller list, so I had to pay for the replacement parts myself. The parts took over a month to arrive, and my printer still doesn't work. Don't buy this printer, or any printer from Flashforge.
customer_reviews.author: PAVatPSU

customer_reviews.title: Major problem after 3 weeks; Flashforge rates a 0 in customer service
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this printer on Amazon and initially it worked really well, was easy to use and printed quality things. However, after 3 weeks we had a problem with the extruder printing on the platform. We called Amazon and they suggested we call Flashforge. We called Flashforge and they said that they could not help us and sent us packing, since we did not purchase directly from them. They were so unhelpful and rude. Luckily, Amazon let us return it since it no longer works. What a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa KB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer! I have been enjoying it for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome printer! I have been enjoying it for the past two months and I only encountered 1 failed print and it was my error. A tip for anyone using this printer: Do not use tape or glue to stop warping. Use hairspray....yes hairspray. I use Aqua Net super hold spray, it keeps the print bed clean and it holds the print extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Buy a cheaper diy 3D kit, it'll  take less time to get to work.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work out of the box. It's not quiet at all, fan is way louder than my other printers. Makes a clicking sound whenver the x-acus moves. Print quality is poor, lots of stringing. Prints don't stick well, and printer often fails 1/2 way through. I wanted a printer that worked out of the box as I am constantly upgrading/tweaking my other printers. I wanted a reliable standby printer that didn't need much effort to get to work, sadly this printer is not it. Returning asap.
customer_reviews.author: travisophila

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed for a month, then kaput.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a month. Will not power up or respond. Refunded to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Garza

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D printer, very user friendly and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have had the product for two weeks now and am extremely happy with this purchase. The build volume is personally a little small at 140 x 140 x 140, but the quality and customization achievable trumps any negative you can think of. It’s extremely easy to learn how to use, and when the nozzle got jammed it was very easy to take apart and fix. UPDATE: I have had this for 1.5 months and am loving it with the only drawback being bed size. WIth the success of this printer though I would recommend buying to the FlashForge Adventurer with an enclosed build, larger build plate, and higher temperature capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D printer for beginners and seasoned users.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use; I was printing withing 30 minutes of opening the box. The software is intuitive yet has enough features for those with more knowledge. NOTE: this printer does not accommodate full sized (1 kg) spools of filament so make sure you either order the 500g spools or get a smaller empty spool to transfer filament from the 1 kg (or rig a way for the 1 kg spool to feed into the printer without snags like I did). Overall a great printer.
customer_reviews.author: DeserayGoddess

customer_reviews.title: Died after five months. Customer support was nonexistent for us.
customer_reviews.text: The initial excitement turned to dismay after five months of use... the FlashForge Finder machine began turning off randomly and regardless of activity (i.e. during print, during warm-up, etc). Unable to resolve with on-line forums... this appears to happen to other people too. FlashForge customer support was requested, but... crickets... no reply. When the machine worked, it worked fine. Unfortunately, the brief lifecycle and lack of support make FlashForge Finder a product that cannot be recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Paul N.

customer_reviews.title: Good starter printer
customer_reviews.text: The Flashforge Finder is a good first 3D printer. If nothing else, I learned some tricks and techniques for making my prints better, and learned what features I wanted in my next printer. The print bed is small, and the software constrains the prints smaller still, but you can definitely print a wide variety of items in decent quality. I've used it for making robot parts, electronics mounting pieces, halloween and cosplay props, and tabletop gaming terrain.
customer_reviews.author: T. E. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Broke in less then 3 weeks. Overheats, extruder jams fails to print and smells like wires are burning. Expensive junk with no service available. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Maz

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value in a sophisticated package
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the quality of the printer, the ease of use, the remote monitoring capability and the finely detailed print results. While the documentation could elaborate on how to maintain the unit, as a whole, the Finder printer far exceeded my expectations!!! UPDATE: just discovered that they no longer include the filament outage sensor in the latest versions of this unit. ☹️ Still a great printer and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pietrykowski

customer_reviews.title: Printer looks great! Software has questionable EULA
customer_reviews.text: From the EULA for the printer's software: 11. APPLICABLE LAW You acknowledge and agree that notwithstanding the fact that this License is governed by the laws of the People’s Republic of China, you may be subject to additional laws in other jurisdictions with respect to your use of the FlashPrint. You will comply with the laws of any jurisdiction that apply to the FlashPrint, including without limitation any applicable export laws or regulations. If you install it you are making your computer subject to the laws of the PRC. Printer itself is pretty cool though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good started but only for small things
customer_reviews.text: I've had the printer for about a month now and have put almost 60 hours on it. The printer is pretty solid and I like the size and how easy it is to work with. But trying to get a program to work with is the hard part. Flashforge has a free program you can use but saying it is limited is an understatement, but there good program is almost $200. I've ended up using Microsoft's 3D printing software to create and the flash forge to print. That's the only "free way" I've been able to work. The printer is alright over all, you cant print thing very large and flash forged isn't the best but it all works.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Pray yours doesn't break
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer and it has always been sub-par levels even when tuned and tinkered. I had to replace the memory card on the motherboard day one. Two years in, replaced the whole hotend, still doesn't print right without errors. Tech support is rubbish. Paying $200-$400 for a piece of machinery with no warranty, not instructions, no repairs. They don't even make their own parts. You have to buy third party.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic introduction to 3D printing: No muss, no fuss -- just print cool things without worrying about all the details of heat, time, etc... "It just works." Within the first week, I'd racked up more than 100 hours of print time (it's not fast, but it's great), and had created some pretty awesome little pieces for my wife and kid. Be warned though: This isn't just a purchase; it's a step into a new hobby that will CONSUME you in no time. It is useless to resist.
customer_reviews.author: VeryVito

customer_reviews.title: Prints okay.  Poor maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: It prints okay. About the same as other printers in the $200 range. The thing that really sucks is the effort it takes to clean a clog. You have to disassemble a bunch of things to get to it with Hex and Phillips and a knife. And if you ever have to change the nozzle, you have to practically disassembled the whole thing. Not designed well for the consumer. As a printer it’s probably 3 or 4 stars. But the maintenance, design and super small print area bring it down to 2 stars. It was a nice printer 5 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Termite

customer_reviews.title: Better than some of the higher priced competitors!
customer_reviews.text: We considered getting a 3D printer that cost more than double the price of this one... I am so glad we didn't! We have friends that have the very same printer that we almost bought--it's not nearly as nice as the Flash Forge. We've printed more than a handful of things with ease and perfection. Very happy with this product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mother Dear

customer_reviews.title: A ready to print out of the box beautiful looking and accurate 3D printer.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this printer! Been working like a charm. Can’t say enough good things about this 3D printer. Reliable, quiet, accurate and looks fantastic! I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a preassembled ready to use out of the box PLA unit. The built in wifi and easy to read display are valuable when using the Polar Cloud web site to download your files to the printer. I printed an external spool holder so I could use full size filament rolls on it. Check out the photos I uploaded on here of a few items that I made with it. A cool watch stand, some tools, and a working sissor lift stand.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box and printing in less than 30 min..excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic little machine...out of the box and printing in less than a half hour. Leveling system is absolutely genius, prints come out excellent even on medium quality...my first printer and I'm super excited about this purchase. Amazing to watch this thing go to work. Love the LCD touch screen, tells you exactly what percentage of the print your at, also the WiFi is an awesome feature as well...btw..setting it up through wifi-- after you've connected to your network, go to the about section and look at what your IP address is, this is the address you will need to input into the software for it to find the printer and send the file.
customer_reviews.author: anjuli

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best purchase I made last year
customer_reviews.text: This little "beginner" printer is a legitimate workhorse. Over 1500 printing hours making dungeon tiles, minis, map pieces, terrain, anything D&D-related that you can think of, and little to no issues. What few issues there have been, FlashForge has responded to any and all tech support emails within 8-12 hours of sending them, and always with a fix that works, both short- and long-term. Only issues I've had is the PTFE tube going out (which, while initially a pain to get the nozzle off, was extremely easy to replace), and the nozzle getting clogged, and both issues FlashForge helped resolve quickly. Can't recommend this printer, or any product from FlashForge enough. Will definitely be buying an Adventurer 3 soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Tech support is pretty bad.
customer_reviews.text: Tech support was poor and when it was "auto leveled" it melted a hole in the plate after it was allegedly leveled. I had to readjust the Z quite after finding out it came out of the factory on such a terrible setting. They were trying to figure out whether or not this was a valid purchase and by the time they got back to me I had found the solution on the forums, however they never replaced the print plate.
customer_reviews.author: dekar1206

customer_reviews.title: Software not updated
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to install the software on 3 different computers and it fails every time. The software hasnt been updated in over a year so it appears its no longer compatible. Its a couple hundred dollar paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Use glue
customer_reviews.text: After a bit of tweaking, we finally found that just spraying Elmer's glue (the aerosol kind) on the building tray keeps the plastic from warping during the printing process. It's a bit tougher to remove, but well worth it. Let it dry before you start printing, and try not to spray the edges so that you can get the tray out a bit easier. Everyone else uses tape, but we had the corners pull up no matter what we did.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This was a great introduction into the hobby of 3D printing
customer_reviews.text: This was a great introduction into the hobby of 3D printing. I’m impressed by the quality for only $400. One thing to watch out for - sometimes I could load the filament very smoothly and other times it wouldn’t go in. I’d try and try without luck and then eventually it would slide right in. Recently when I was having trouble getting the filament in I disassembled the printer head and removed a small bit of plastic debris. As problems come up, whether with the print quality or the machine operations, just YouTube it, and someone will help you out.
customer_reviews.author: Abigailp

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: So far a very positive experience. It was easy to setup, although an English manual would have been nice. I recommend you look at one of the many YouTube videos instead. The prints are very clean on high setting. I also printed a Hatchbox reel holder right away since the don’t fit in the printer slot. That work great. Also make sure you apply the included glue before every print, I pull the bed out and wash it after and apply new glue. Or you can use the 3m tape method. Glue does work well. Very happy with this purchase so far, my daughter is finally of the computer and doing something fun;-)
customer_reviews.author: Vince B.

customer_reviews.title: Good machine, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: CONS: It has a bit of an issue with spillover. As in while it's moving around printing something intricate, it has a tendency to spawn tons of threads all over the place which makes it a bit of a task to clean the final product up at the end... Also, the software itself isn't bad, but the auto-supports it spawns when setting up a print are always running in strange places that make it difficult to clean up when it's printed. **Will add pictures of current intricate print soon to show what I mean.**
customer_reviews.author: Cytozen

customer_reviews.title: Great printer,  great price!!
customer_reviews.text: Picked this printer up after a lot of research and an very pleased with it. Very easy to set up, I was printing within 10 minutes of unboxing. At $500, the prints are amazingly on par with the Makerbot Z18 Replicator I have access to at work and is much quieter to boot! Software is very easy to use. Over printed parts from thingiverse as well as my own creations (built in Solidworks) work no issues. Attached are a couple of airsoft gun parts I printed, a camera rail mount and a flash hider.
customer_reviews.author: Tweak89

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: It's a great performer for a $400 3D printer. It will not be as precise as the more expensive 3D printers, but it does a great job at smaller, 1-piece projects. If you are looking to build something larger and connect the pieces together, you will not be satisfied with this, as this isn't really accurate enough to make something like that. Great bang for the buck though!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: This is a great point and shoot product
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased a few years ago and the start up learning curve was very easy. It has built in wifi, it can connect through firewire, and it is as close to point and shoot as it comes. Tip rarely clogs, on highest print settings prints are nice and smooth. If you're shopping around and you do not need a large print area, I would recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua S. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Amazing 3D printer, amazing support - I am really happy (SO FAR!)
customer_reviews.text: I bought another 3D printer and I decided after reading about FlashForge that the Finder was a better way to go. For the money, this has to be the best built 3D printer on the market. Big, plenty of metal parts. Really impressed. The setup instructions aren't bad but I didn't understand how to feed the filament in my firsprint job. I contacted support, got instant response but I found the answer in a Youtube video. You don't press the springer while forcing the filament vertically into the extruder. Instead, once the extruder is hot, gently feed the filament in and let the gears feed it in. Works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Software Maniac

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: The first printer I received from Amazon had a broken belt. However, it was replaced immediately without any hassle at all. I just dropped it off at Kohl's and a new one was shipped. The replacement that was sent is perfect. Really easy to set up, and really easy to use software. You need to go to the Flashforge website and download it, but very happy it's simple to use and not bloated. From my very first print this machine printed FLAWLESSLY. Perfect reproductions! I was expecting a lot of trial and error, and am thrilled this is a turn key product that is perfect for a beginner like me. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal - Only us PLA Filament,
customer_reviews.text: Only us PLA filament, I had no idea there was more than one type and could not get prints to stick. The machine has worked flawlessly using PLA filament. Although I did need tech help at first and it took waaayy too much to get help, after figuring out my filament situation, no problems. Great deal! It is a product to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Works well, don’t overtighten
customer_reviews.text: Great printer for the money. Be nice if print area was a little larger, but good for the money. Had an issue with the Filament that came with it (brittle, and has broken a few times). But performs well with higher quality materials. on a side note, when calibrating, it says “tighten as much as you can”, but in reality don’t go overboard. I tightened it a bit too much and noticed I had to loosen it a bit to get the printing platform to level properly. If it has a gap in height when setting it up, you probably tightened it to to much.
customer_reviews.author: AlanJ

customer_reviews.title: Couldnt be happier as a first 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Super easy to use and is ready to print almost right out of the box. Some simple set up is required but its just getting the machine loaded and ready to print. I can make a design, connect my printer to my computer, (Using the program that came with it, on the USB) and have something printing in 10 minutes. Depending on the size of the project it will take time but still super cool. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KGS2218

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This was my first 3D printer. I had two issues since I purchased it. The printer comes with a customer service agent on the front label that I was able to contact. One issue required parts to be sent from the manufacturer that was broken due to my carelessness. The second issue involved not printing round objects. Service was great. I sent a picture and they identified what was wrong, then sent a video on how to fix it. Now it works wonderful. I gave this 5 stars due to the service and the quality of the print. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Konzen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The printer isn’t great for starting out. That being said, I would not recommend this printer to anyone. Save a little more money and get a bigger, more reliable printer like a CR-10. Print quality is not great, noise is loud and has constant jams. Support is nowhere to be found when you need something. Buy a better printer.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mounce

customer_reviews.title: End of life after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Santa left this. Kids loved it, easy to use. Let me be clear, I followed all OEM instructions for use and care. We went thru 8 spools of PLA. On average we printed daily. Problems started after 3 months, was the clogs on extruder first. After checking, calibrate and unclogging it worked for two weeks and started again. The next 3 months were spent replacing extruder, ptfe tube, change of filament and gear to feed pla. Second 3 months was a small investment to keep santas gift alive, but I am afraid we just wore it out.
customer_reviews.author: HAL9000

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Researched 3D printer and this printer was the best for beginners. What a joke the leveling process was a nightmare. The first printer I received was refurbished and the replacement dis not level after 3 days I gave up. Technical support is non existent and for the first time I can say Amazon customer service was horrible. The printer states it comes with amazon technical support and tech support asked me to get the guide and wanted to review what I had done that’s not technical support. No YouTube video to assist nothing. Insane how something that looks so simple can be so difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Marie Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy 12 Year Old
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my son's 12th birthday. He absolutely loves it. He was able to download the software and use it within 15 minutes of opening the box. The filament that comes with the printer is not the highest of quality, but it was good enough for him to practice with. I have a list of requests to be printed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing printer and customer support
customer_reviews.text: Printer takes 10 minutes to set up and print one of the two test designs. YouTube videos are worth watching. Tang (customer support) is awesome and very quick to respond to questions (Keep in mind the time difference). Had a couple questions and they were responded to with personalized help and instructions. Customer service is obviously very important. Printer is super user-friendly and the price can’t be beat. If this printer gives me a few years use, it will be the best money I’ve spent.
customer_reviews.author: Kingkongmegatron

customer_reviews.title: Amazing 3d
customer_reviews.text: First time every using a 3d printer and this one can't be any easier and amazing. Easy set up and was up printing within an hour. Lots of sites already have stl images made up and easy to import. The only learning curve was to use glue stick on your plate and it will help our your prints so much .. Also I used what they called a raft which prints a little base for the item being printed and that also helps out the prints.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Great, unless there are problems.
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot of online support for this product. However, if you do need to speak to someone from FlashFinder to fix the problem, everything is by e-mail. Which can mean hours getting the support you need. Taking the flashforge finder apart in order to replace something, such as a nozzle, is easy to do. I had to replace the thermostat. After following the directions, it would still not work. If the videos and e-mails don't fix your problem, then you are out of luck. It's not like you can return this to best buy and have them fix it for you.
customer_reviews.author: Masulsa

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this 3D Printer brand
customer_reviews.text: Like several other people have experienced with their reviews of this printer, we’ve had multiple issues and did no more than 15 print jobs and now the printer isn’t working . Total Waste of time and money and now tech support communicates that I need to buy parts, install myself, and remove gobs of melted filament even though we’re well within the warranty period. See attached photos that were provided to FlashForge. Buy a better brand and avoid the hassles.
customer_reviews.author: MrPercussion

customer_reviews.title: If the build volume was larger, this would be a 5 star item.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, this worked really well. Some detailed instructions on doing your first print would have been nice, but I figured it out relatively easily. The software that runs this works just fine. Takes a little playing with to figure out the X/Y/X orientation of the item. And sometimes it is not intuitive that you want to print something lying down rather than standing up. But that has nothing to do with this product. Great product for the money. If this had a larger print volume it would be an absolute 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton D. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Great all around 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this printer. I was debating on getting a DYI one for half the price but I didn't want to fiddle with flimsy parts or troubleshooting something that got mixed up during construction of the unit. This thing is literally out of the box ready-to-go. The Flashprint software that comes with it makes slicing the files a breeze with a lot of customization. My work loves it also so they decided to buy one as well. I have had several coworkers buy this after seeing the prints. I would highly recommend based on the quality of the prints, the ability to use third party filaments and the great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cousin as a birthday gift, and he loves it! He has been printing non-stop since December, and he is getting really good at it. There is a learning curve at first, trying to get the speed and heat just right. But after a couple small failed attempts, he is printing things like a pro. He even printed me my very own Eevee!
customer_reviews.author: Cady Heron

customer_reviews.title: I loved both of my previous printers
customer_reviews.text: Having started with a Printrbot simple (1405, wooden frame), and a Prusa i3 (clone). I loved both of my previous printers, but this thing is INCREDIBLE! my only complaint (which isn't one) is that the print area is just a touch too small. My next 3d printer will be a FlashForge Creator Pro...
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: No Fuss 3D Printing
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a 3D printed that doesn't require much fussing with, the FlashForge works great! As with most 3D printers, I initially had issues getting parts to stick to the plate, but after using the gluestick (included with the printer) on the build surface, I then had problems getting parts off the plate. Finally, I had to use a metal putty knife and get under one edge of the part and then whole part pops off. I was worried I might damage the build surface using a metal putty knife, but found the build surface is quite resilient. Now I use the metal putty knife to remove all my parts from the plate and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good printer for under $400
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 80 yr old father. Easy enough for him to operate without any issues. Too early to talk about reliability, but appears well built, has good print quality, isn't too loud,and can accept cheaper filament using filament holder one can print out and attach to back
customer_reviews.author: rmc

customer_reviews.title: Easiest 3d printer you'll find
customer_reviews.text: I regret this being my first printer because it set the bar so high. This printer and it's software is SOO easy to use. The prints come out great, the only thing is you need to be careful when using supports because they can leave rough surface behind when you break them off. Find a model you like and print it using a few different methods until you figure things out.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dombrowski

customer_reviews.title: Amazing beginner printer. Couldn't be happier with it!
customer_reviews.text: Hundreds of prints in and it still works great! This is my first 3D printer, but I can't imagine a simpler, more streamlined experience. Only 'issues' I see is a slow extrusion when the tip heats up. I have to make sure to scoop it off before it begins printing. Not sure if other printers have this same behavior though.
customer_reviews.author: SlyMcNasty

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I have been working with 3d printers with my university for quite some time, mostly the ultimaker 2, and that drove me to purchase one for myself. After extensive research, I settled on the finder. I was very impressed with the quality of the printer and the prints. Printing on the ultra setting makes the resolution almost seamless. The only downside to the printer is the print area. There is so much wasted space inside the print chamber that could easily be utilized to make larger prints. All in all, if I had to choose a printer for under $500, I would choose this one again. Very reliable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow, wow, wow
customer_reviews.text: Nice. out of the box nice. I bought a Tevo Tornado earlier this year and it has been nothing but trouble, only two successful prints. Still working on it. Bought this to see if I was crazy. And I may be crazy, but this printer is all good for me. Well almost. It uses non-standard spools, so I had to string from my Tevo Spool holder.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. McElroy

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: The product design it self is defective. The base panel doesn’t have heating function and the model won’t stick onto the base model. I contacted the manufacturer and they said that’s just the problem with entry level products. Completely waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Alex H.

customer_reviews.title: Ordering printer was easy, shipping arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: Ordering printer was easy, shipping arrived on time, unpacking was as expected, a few loose screws found inside packaging and inside machine, quick e-mail to Tang to ensure warrenty would be intact I removed the back plate to remove loose screws. I could not see any missing screws on machine. So I turned on my brand new FlashForge Finder 3d printer and started printing with no issues or problems. It prints faster than expected. A month later, I am on my second roll of fillament and still have a smile on my face.
customer_reviews.author: g

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Love it ! The learning curve is kinda steep and you have to be somewhat mechanically inclined but YouTube is your friend . I would suggest buying a nozzle with the printer just to have on hand downtime sucks . You will find the bed is fairly small a lot of stuff I want to build is too big BUT the bigger bed units require a lot more knowledge so great to learn on
customer_reviews.author: andy meddley

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY PRINTS AND EASY TO USE!
customer_reviews.text: Only had it 1 day and am obsessed with it! Very nicely packaged and great build quality. Instructions are very clear and user-friendly. Got the whole thing unboxed, setup and had my first print done in an hour. People told me 3d printers under $1000 were junk but this is definitely not junk. Great value and fun!
customer_reviews.author: redlinepa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for just over a week and I have printed 11 objects. This printer works amazingly but make sure to put glue on the print bed or your prints might come unstuck during the middle of the print. it is extremely detailed and I would totally buy it again if it broke. overall amazing printer!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: CNEU

customer_reviews.title: My machine stop extruding during print
customer_reviews.text: Everything seemed to be perfect and the machine has very good design, but after 6 prints it started to sound loud and I realized that also stopped feeding the filament during the printing. I bought the replacement of the nozzle and the cleaning kit, technical support told me to update the firmware and nothing, the printer was still making the same noise and stopped feeding the filament, so I had to returned to dont lose more money trying to fix it and work time...
customer_reviews.author: Angel Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Something is missing from our printer
customer_reviews.text: WE ordered this printer because a friend of ours got one too however we are unable to make ours work. He said we need a USB drive/flash drive to download to make the software work? He has one and it came with his printer. How come one wasn't included in our printer? Please let me know what I need to do in order to get our new printer to work. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner printer/ Tech support
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer for Beginners. I have had on this new problems with this printer at all. When I had problems the tech-support help tremendously and solving my problems. In addition to that the response time is really good. Highly recommend this pe beginners. I have had almost no problems with this printer at all. When I had problems the tech-support help tremendously in solving my problems. In addition to that the response time is really good. Highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and fantastic
customer_reviews.text: For my future mechanical engineer, it has been invaluable to have a 3D printer at his disposal in our home. He quickly and easily figured out how to work the machine, and has used it extensively with no problems, and I am hopeful that trend will continue!
customer_reviews.author: Mom Review

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how you could do better for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very favorable impression after the first 8 hours of printing (6 different parts). Unit seems well built, spool management is nice, and the removable build plate makes getting the parts out easy. Very quiet when printing - basically zero noise from the stepper motors. I have owned a total of 8 3D printers so I have a reasonable frame of reference to judge this one by. I use Simplify3D for generating print files so I have no judgement on their included software. **** 1 year later **** Still having great luck with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: GMoneyPhx

customer_reviews.title: Good luck finding spools. 7 1/8 spools on FLASHFORGE. Standard is 8 inches. Returning.
customer_reviews.text: Update: 3-23-2019. Returning printer because I can't find correct sized spools. Thanks Frances from customer service. I am getting a refund and am waiting for a return shipping label. Otherwise nice printer. // Works great out of the box. Test cube was great. I will try benchy next. 5 stars for being ready out of the box with preparation required (bed levelling) as advertised. I will update after trying downloads and my own models. Seems great so far. Small print bed. Read specs.
customer_reviews.author: jbucher

customer_reviews.title: Great printer except for print size
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer, I have had it for 2 years now. The print quality is amazing and I would highly recommend for a beginner. I am giving it only 4 stars because of the size of the prints. I wish there was a bigger build volume, but the prints are such high quality that it really doesn’t matter. I would also say that it is the quietest 3d printer on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is awesome. It came all installed ready to use out of the box. I am on my print #5 and have had no problems. The only thing where i messed up is in the preheating the first time. I didn't realize the filament was dripping from the nozzle when it was heating up and it burned a small hole in the middle of my platform. To get around that, I just place my prints around the hole. So be careful when preheating! Check out my prints at [...]
customer_reviews.author: Zo

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Broke after two months use
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice printer for awhile until it stopped working after less than two months. Amazon will not support a return past one month. I spent $375 on this in July and it stopped working early September. UPDATE: the support was great, they sent a new part to fix and now is working great
customer_reviews.author: Midwest mom

customer_reviews.title: My brother was visiting for the holidays and he loved it so much he is going to buy one ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for xmas and he absolutely LOVES it. The thing has been running non-stop since he got it. My brother was visiting for the holidays and he loved it so much he is going to buy one for himself. A geeks total must have! Me I'm not so impressed because I have lost my husband to a machine. He is totally obsessed with building all kinds of fantasy figures and stuff and painting it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Fife

customer_reviews.title: New models may be defective-
customer_reviews.text: I bought the printer and could not print anything properly. I went through the steps as indicated even speaking to the tech support but the printer would not calibrate, heat the extruder too much or would not load the filament correct. Maybe I got a defective model. I returned it after I spent almost 14 hours messing with it. I gave 2 stars for the tech support trying to help however I was upset when the tech told me the picture of the print I did that I sent him was not "too bad". It supposed to look like the green one, the one the printer did was the purple one.
customer_reviews.author: Mommielovefun

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this easy to use, the wifi ability to send things via the cloud is really helpful!! Works perfectly everytime! Had it setup and printing inside 30 mins. I wanted to try 3D printing, and this was the perfect choice. Easy to use, great support, and it works beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: Walter Betson

customer_reviews.title: for the price this printer works great. I am able to print somewhat complicated designs ...
customer_reviews.text: for the price this printer works great. I am able to print somewhat complicated designs with a better success rate than I had with the much more expensive Makerbot Replicator 2. I would definitely buy this printer again. As long as you keep the print bed clean and level almost everything sticks to it. It does not use proprietary 3D filament, so you can use pretty much anything that is on the market. I just wish the manufacturer would sell replacement parts on Amazon instead of their Ebay store.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Spase

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and fun for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This was for our son and it was very easy to set up and easy to use. The wireless printing doesn't always work consistently, but it works fine when loading files on a flash drive. The software is also easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rich P.

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Printer!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this 3D printer. We bought a different one first that had a larger print area, but had nothing but trouble getting it set up. We returned that one and ordered this one instead, and had it out of the box and printing quickly. The print quality is excellent and it's very easy to use this printer. When we had questions about printing or anything else, a customer support representative responded very quickly and got us back up and running again. We would highly recommend this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlea

customer_reviews.title: We cannot get it to work!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my second 3-D printer from Amazon and this one doesn't work either. The first one would only drop gobs of melted filament. Now the second one will not advance in set up beyond changing the language. We are very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: m nji

customer_reviews.title: Missing thumb drive
customer_reviews.text: This is my third printer of this model. The other two came with a thumb drive with sample prints to make sure it works as well as a drive to move prints to the printer. This printer came without a thumb drive and the PLA roll seems about half the size that was previously sent with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Gary G Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Great first printer
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and quick to make your first prints. Only drawbacks are lack of a heated bed and smallish build-volume. But those are understandable for the price. So, if you've always wondered whether 3D printing is something you'd like to try... Try this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gwynne

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as gift for my dad for Christmas and he loves it! He's been playing around with the templates and the temperature to get a crisp model. The quality that this creates is really impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Sam B

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is the first 3D I have purchased and it is horrible. It worked for 1 day then kept getting clogged. After several weeks of emails back and forth with the manufacturer for support it is still not working. Now I am past the return date with amazon and the manufacturer is no longer responding to emails. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Seana McPherson

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dime!!! look no further!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to get this 3D printer as a result of originally getting the XYZ 3D printer, which was made cheap, and after two days was breaking down every other day. I sent it back, to replace it with the Flashforge Finder, and it is awesome!!! I am amazed on what this printer can do. I would don't waste your time looking for the best deal, the best deal is getting something that works great, and produces more then you can expect!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Came completely broken. After a couple hours online looking up how it was supposed to be I got it to start running. Seems to work really well actually, for the time being anyway. Would have probably been five stars if not for the condition it arrived in.
customer_reviews.author: Debr

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love my Finder. I have had limited issues with this printer and everything is easily solvable. Right out of the box I was printing successfully. I had one little glitch with the extruder plugging up, but was able to resolve that after reading the message boards. What a great printer.
customer_reviews.author: Irene M

customer_reviews.title: Easy out of box setup.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this on Friday and already hooked! Its an easy out of box setup. Take it out of the box, cut the zip ties and remove the Styrofoam, turn it on and it guides you through the base level adjustment and loading the filament. After that you just plug in the usb stick and print! Only printed about 4 things so far but all of them have been perfect with very smooth detail. Will update soon after about 20 or so prints.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!  Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked great after calibration on the first print. I had to contact service to see how to update the firmware so I could use different software. Tang from customer service was extremely helpful and did an amazing job walking me through and explaining all the features. He even replied to my email again after I said thanks and he wanted to know why I wanted to make the changes I needed, he wanted to help further to make my prints even better. I highly recommend this printer and Flashforge 3d printers.
customer_reviews.author: Chad R.

customer_reviews.title: Other wise seems to be very good.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have is the lack of information. They don't provide the guide for proper care, they don't tell you what the grease is for, they don't say how to care for the bed and how to keep it clean. The other is no matter what I do, I am unable to get the extruder to change temperature it's always on 220 degrees, pre-heat changes but not the operating. Other wise seems to be very good.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: came out very good..
customer_reviews.text: Printed the test boxes .. came out very good .... then printed the bottom and top cases for a raspbery pi 3 ... wow .... i am a novice at this ,... need to find out a better way to remove the work from the bed ... using 3M blue tape .. still hard ... all in all ... very pleased
customer_reviews.author: R Saulnier

customer_reviews.title: This printer is wonderful for anyone who wants to start 3D printing without ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer is wonderful for anyone who wants to start 3D printing without wasting thousands of dollars. Very high quality prints. My only problem is that it includes a gluestick to be used for an adhesive to the build plate. DO NOT USE THIS. I tried using hairspray, but found that painters tape works wonders. Calibration every two or three prints is no hassle and ensures a great build. VERY HAPPY WITH THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Best 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked out great with this printer. It is easy to set up, quiet, has no smell and has no issues running all day. It is easy to switch out the filament and upload new prints. It certainly made my first 3D printer purchase very easy and rewarding. Very reliable. Although if you try to connect your printer to the driver after the printer has been on a long time, it will not connect. All you have to do is turn off the printer and turn it back on. The High quality setting is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great Start!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he likes it. As this is his first machine this is a great starter printer. He has made a few things although some of it took a few tries because the filament end up like strings but like all things its trial and error and he has been able to figure out the problem and fix it (user error) so i highly recomend this as a starter printer so far.
customer_reviews.author: Evemari86

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Printer & Customer Service!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can not say enough positive things about this little printer. I use it in my k-4 classroom and am very pleased with the quality of prints. Any time I've had a question or encountered a problem, I've had quick responses and solutions from Mr. Tang. Recently I broke a small piece, and even though I had exceeded my 90 day warranty, Tang is replacing the piece for FREE. I am thrilled I chose FlashForge for my school!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer .. no filaments available which fit into the enclosure.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer .. accuracy and usability are great especially the Wifi with the Flashforge application. The only reason I made it 4 stars is the lack of filaments .. none are available on Amazon which fit within the compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure all the parts are with it
customer_reviews.text: The printer is ok but they didn’t send the flash drive with it so now I have to get one that works with the printer. Very disappointed in that. Otherwise the printer works well with the sample prints.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ocallaghan Jr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home usage.
customer_reviews.text: I've been printing lots of objects with this printer so far and the print quality has been superb! It's quite a lot more quiet compared to the Flashforge Creator Pro. It's probably the best bang for the buck of any 3d printer i've come across while striking the right balance between quality and price!
customer_reviews.author: JJ Tan

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer.
customer_reviews.text: Works great . I recommend changing the temp to 240°C instead of 220, the filament seemed to cool too soon and stuck to the nozzle. Instead of using the usb stick I plugged my laptop in the the printer. For me it's alot more simple. I just download files on Thingiverse and open them with Flashpoint. You're able to change the LED color this way too. It's a neat machine and im happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Robles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer! The first one that was sent did ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome printer! The first one that was sent did not print correctly, it printed on a lean. I called amazon and they had another one out to me in 2 days and the second one works better than expected. Other 3d enthusiasts are surprised by the detail of this 100 micron printer. There are options before you print to go into expert mode and really open up what you are able to do with this printer. I was able to eliminate webbing and shorten the layers.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Machine broke within 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: I was able to successfully print 4 items. Within 24 hours of receiving the printer, the temperature sensor went out. I went ahead and returned it and will purchase a different printer. The wifi unit also didn't work. I was not able to connect to the printer wirelessly. Set up was easy. I was able to get printing within an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Hai

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great seller
customer_reviews.text: We were up and running and printing in less than 10 minutes. 7 prints later, not a single fail. Only (minor) complaint --- having a hard time scraping items off of the build plate. Use tape, and you're good to go. Now for the important part --- this seller is awesome. Do not confuse them with FlashForge USA (not the same company/seller). When I mentioned to Tang that FF USA were having a promotion, AFTER I had made my purchase, he promptly offered to match the promotion, even though he didn't have to. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Oren

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy to use, good results
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a first foray into 3D printing. When looking for a printer I had no idea what to expect, and I assumed I'd have a fairly steep learning curve to climb. I was very pleasantly surprised with how easy this flashforge printer is to use. Had it set up and printing a real model from Thingiverse less than an hour after I opened the box. After a few tries my kids (9 and 12) are now printing pieces on their own. Would definitely recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary LaLonde

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer...I've been churning out prints for a few weeks now, and I've been consistently impressed with the quality of the results. It's been both fun and productive. Printing is not without challenges - bed adhesion was a tricky issue for me - but the support (as others have mentioned) is excellent: both timely and good feedback. (As a disclaimer, for software I've been using Simplify3D, so I haven't even tried the supplied printing software). Bed leveling takes a little practice to get the hang of, but is straightforward once you do. I highly recommend the FlashForge Finder.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Thomason

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Got for my 11yr old for Christmas and it’s been so perfect. Even got some technical support via email and videos when the extruded was plugged. Worked great ever since. My son loves making all kinds of things !
customer_reviews.author: K.M

product_meta.title: FlashForge Finder 3D Printers with Cloud, Wi-Fi, USB cable and Flash drive connectivity
product_meta.description: FlashForge is improving and doing the updates from time to time. To make sure you have the best experience with the 3d printer, please ALWAYS UPDATE FIRMWARE TO LATEST VERSION. You can do firmware update on the printer quickly. Here are the steps: 1. Turn on the printer and go to touch screen menu “Tools—Setting WiFi”. 2. Enable WiFi by slipping the icon at top right corner. Printer will scan available wireless networks. 3. Select your own network and enter password to connect. 4. After successful WiFi connection, go to touch screen menu “Tools—Setting—Update” to update firmware to latest version. If you need video instruction, please contact me and I will send you the link. Meet the new kid on the block. the user-friendly, home-friendly, and wallet-friendly 3D printer from FlashForge is ready to play. Loaded with easy-to-use features, and designed to be at home in kids rooms and classrooms, the new FlashForge Finder is the first choice for 3D printing novices and educators. Beginners benefit from the slide-in build plate, assisted bed-leveling, and intuitive color touchscreen. And parents and teachers appreciate its quiet and safe operation. The Finder uses only non-toxic PLA, and the heated components are safely encased. The creative world of 3D printing awaits, and the FlashForge Finder is here to show you the way. What’s in the box? Quick start guide After-sales service card Power cable Filament guide tube Tool bag(Contains 2×Allen wrench, Wrench, Screwdriver, Unclogging pin tool, PTFE tube, Grease) Finder 3D Printer 1 roll of 300g PLA filament, color randomly selected Power adapter USB cable Solid glue Printing technology- FFF (Fused Filament Fabrication) Build volume: 140 L x 140 W x 140 H mm Layer resolution: 100-400 microns, adjustable Positioning precision: 11 microns on x and Y and 2.5 microns on Z Filament diameter: 1.75 mm Nozzle diameter: 0.4 mm Frame and body: plastic and alloy Extruder quantity: one Product dimension: 420 x 420 x 420 mm Product weight: 16 kg Software: FlashPrint(No USB stick is included in the package, users need to download from FlashForge official website http://www.flashforge.com/support-center/finder/) File Type: STL, obj Operating systems: Windows 7/8/8.1/10, Mac OS x and Linux Printing via Wi-Fi, USB cable，USB stick and Cloud Language support: English/Chinese Printing material: PLA only. Support Contact Information If you encounter any issues with your FlashForge purchase or have any questions, please contact the expert support team at 597891915@qq.com
feature_bullets: Slide-in build plate allows printed objects to be easily removed
3.5-Inch full color touchscreen with intuitive icons makes for easy operation
Sturdy, plastic alloy construction ensures stable prints
Wi-Fi, usb and flash drive connectivity.Positioning Precision: 0.0001 inch on Z axis, 0.0004 inch on XY plane Resolution: 0.004 inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
